pageProps.content:
Experience

Shamwari Game Reserve is one of the most established wildlife areas in the Eastern Cape & is renowned for its Big 5 wildlife viewing, luxurious lodges & exceptional conservation initiatives.
Shamwari has 7 different lodges & 1 explorer camp, each providing distinct experiences: Long Lee Manor, Lobengula, Eagles Crag, Bayethe, Sarili, Riverdene, Sindile & Explorer Camp - each with its own style & brand of luxury.

Stay

Shamwari Long Lee Manor boasts Edwardian styled rooms & suites. There are 4 garden rooms, 11 plains rooms, 2 manor house suites & 1 family suite.
The 4 garden rooms overlook the beautifully manicured gardens & have private verandas, showcasing beautiful views of the surrounding plains. These rooms are interleading, making them ideal for families travelling with children.
The 11 plains rooms, as the name suggests, overlook the Shamwari plains – a beautiful sight indeed! Each of these rooms has an outdoor shower & 1 room is adapted for wheelchair use.
The 2 manor house suites are located within the historic manor house, dating back to 1910. These suites are the epitome of luxury & have balconies overlooking the rim-flow pool & impressive waterhole.
The family suite has 2 bedrooms, a living room & private plunge pool & sleeps a maximum of 4 adults & 2 children.
Shamwari Long Lee Manor’s main area includes a large rim-flow swimming pool & pool-side bar, a lovely dining room with both indoor & outdoor seating as well as a boma for dining under the African skies. Long Lee Manor also has a spa & fitness zone.

Activities

Activities include game drives, walks, spa treatments, Kids Club, a photographic course & getting involved in the Wildlife Rehabilitation Programme or the Born Free Big Cat Sanctuary.
